action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenauer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to reduce Federal spending on crop insurance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Assisting Family Farmers through Insurance Reform Measures Act or the AFFIRM Act.

section.header: Crop insurance premium subsidies disclosure in the public interest
section.text: Section 502(c)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1502(c)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as subparagraphs (C) and (D), respectively; and
by inserting before subparagraph (C) (as so redesignated) the following:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1) or any other provision of law, except as provided in subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall on an annual basis make available to the public—

subclause.text: the name of each individual or entity that obtained a federally subsidized crop insurance, livestock, or forage policy or plan of insurance during the previous reinsurance year;
the amount of premium subsidy received by the individual or entity from the Corporation; and
the amount of any Federal portion of indemnities paid in the event of a loss for that reinsurance year for each policy associated with that individual or entity; and

clause.text: for each private insurance provider, a description by the name of the private insurance provider of—

subclause.text: the underwriting gains earned through participation in the federally subsidized crop insurance program; and
the amount paid under this subtitle for—

item.text: any Federal portion of indemnities and reinsurance; and

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall not disclose under subparagraph (A) information relating to individuals and entities covered by a catastrophic risk protection plan offered under section 508(b).

section.header: Adjusted gross income and per person limitations on share of insurance premiums paid by corporation
section.text: Section 508(e)(1) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking For the purpose and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C), for the purpose

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Corporation shall not pay a part of the premium for additional coverage for any person or legal entity that has an average adjusted gross income (as defined in section 1001D(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1308–3a(a))) that is greater than $250,000.
The Corporation shall not pay more than $125,000 for any reinsurance year to any person or legal entity for premiums under this section.

section.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for harvest price policies
section.text: Section 508(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for harvest price policies
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, beginning with the 2023 reinsurance year, the Corporation shall not pay any amount of premium subsidy in the case of a policy or plan of insurance that is based on the actual market price of an agricultural commodity on the date of harvest.

section.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for producers not engaged in active personal labor or active personal management
section.text: Section 508(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)), as amended by section 4, is further amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for producers not engaged in active personal labor active personal management

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, beginning with the 2023 reinsurance year, the Corporation shall not pay any amount of premium subsidy to a producer that is not engaged in active personal labor or active personal management with respect to the farming operation pursuant to which such subsidy would apply.

clause.text: The term active personal labor means, with respect to a producer, physical labor and activities personally performed by the producer on a farming operation—

item.text: are necessary to such farming operation, including land preparation, planting, cultivating, harvesting and marketing of agricultural commodities;
establish or maintain conserving cover crops or conserving use acreages; or
are required for livestock operations; and

subclause.text: for, with respect to a crop year, a period of at least—

item.text: 50 percent of the total hours that would be required to conduct a farming operation comparable in size to the producer’s share in the farming operation, as determined by the Corporation.

clause.text: The term active personal management means management activities personally performed on a farming operation—

subclause.text: by a person with a direct or indirect ownership interest in that farming operation;
on a regular continuous, and substantial basis; and
for, with respect to a crop year, a period of at least—

item.text: 50 percent of the total management hours required for that farming operation on an annual basis, as determined by the Corporation.

section.header: Maximum amount of additional prevented planting coverage
section.text: Section 508(h)(6) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1508(h)(6)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: A crop loss of a producer may only be covered by the additional prevented planting coverage if, during the 3-year period preceding such loss, such producer had less than or equal to 2 crop losses covered by the additional prevented planting coverage.

section.text: Section 508(i) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1508(i)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: If the Corporation makes a determination that a producer has received 3 or more indemnities under a plan of insurance for the same type of loss during a 4-year period, the Corporation shall, with respect to such producer, reduce the premium rate of such plan by 15 percent (except in no case may such premium rate be less than zero).

section.header: Cap on overall rate of return for crop insurance providers
section.text: Section 508(k)(3) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(k)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the paragraph designation and heading and all that follows through The and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Limitation on average rate of return
subparagraph.text: The target average rate of return for reinsured companies for the 2023 reinsurance year and each subsequent reinsurance year shall be 8.9 percent of retained premiums.

section.header: Cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating expenses of crop insurance providers
section.text: Section 508(k)(4) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(k)(4)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Notwithstanding subparagraphs (A) through (F), the total amount of reimbursements for administrative and operating costs for the 2023 reinsurance year for all types of policies and plans of insurance shall not exceed $900,000,000.

For the 2024 reinsurance year and each subsequent reinsurance year, the dollar amount in effect pursuant to clause (i) shall be increased by the inflation factor established for the administrative and operating costs limitation in the 2011 Standard Reinsurance Agreement.

section.text: Section 508(k)(8) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(k)(8)) is amended by striking subparagraph (F).
